text: they passed their bar exam is essentially saying that like Mr Farina was explaining to Joffrey essentially how to do things but from my understanding during the depositions one of the tactics attorneys will use is that they'll have a document that essentially has some sort of transcription or information and then they'll ask the person about what's on the document without showing them and then essentially what they're trying to do is get a contradiction they'll say like what did you do last Tuesday and the person will say what they think they did last Tuesday and they'll say oh interesting because in this email over here it says you did this last Tuesday what does that mean right so they're they're trying to create problems that's that's why depositions go the way they go it's why you'll see attorneys ask questions 16 million times that's the same question they just try to rephrase it slightly and the whole goal there it's just attrition these are long sessions where they're beating you over the head with these questions just trying to find small holes and Kinks that they can pull out the other thing is that they want to make sure that they're getting to a point what their response is so that when if and when it goes to trial they already know your answer because they've essentially boxed you into an answer going through the deposition process so if they say what did you do last Tuesday
